blocking_issues: Missing get_protection_status() method - cannot query protection status of files without scanning entire tree
recommendations: Add get_protection_status() method to LouisWarden that returns protection status for single file or all protected files
Consider adding get_protection_status(rel_path: str = None) -> dict that returns {'is_protected': bool, 'is_locked': bool, 'in_protected_folder': bool}
Alternatively, implement get_all_protection_status() -> List[dict] that returns status for all files in protected-files.txt
Lock/unlock methods use stat flags (S_IRUSR | S_IRGRP | S_IROTH) instead of direct octal 0o444/0o644, which is functionally equivalent but less readable
Consider adding method to check if file is in protected list: is_protected(rel_path: str) -> bool
